title: GeoToSchemtic
description: Convert KML and GeoJSON files into Minecraft schematics using BuildTheEarth projection!
description2:
Upload your files and set the desired settings, then click "Convert".
All converted schematics can be pasted into their correct positions in BuildTheEarth world using //paste -o -a.
status_success: Success! Use "//paste -a -o" to correctly place your schematic
status_error: Error while reading the file. Please make sure that your file is correct
status_error_toobig: Hold on, your file is too big for one schematic! How about splitting it into smaller ones?
status_error_wronglegacyid: Wrong block ID, please use text IDs of blocks that are presented in 1.12.2
offset_tooltip:
Additional schematic offset.
Output schematic files already contain BTE-projected coordinates, which the "//paste -o" command uses to correctly place the schematic. However, some BTE servers use an additional world offset, usually in Y level. This offset should be specified in this section, and it'll be added to BTE coordinates. Most servers don't have an additional offset, so you don't need to change anything here.
conselevation_tooltip: Place objects at their expected height in the schematic based on their altitude value specified in the kml/geojson file.<hr>If unchecked, all objects will be on Y level 0, regardless of their altitude values.
fillterrain_tooltip:
Fill gaps between contour lines in a topographic schematic using the scanline fill algorithm. Experimental feature. There may be some misplaced blocks, but they are easy to spot and fix manually.
Emerald blocks will be generated between all diamond blocks along the X and Z axes. The diamond contours themselves will remain intact. This works with both enclosed and open contours. There must be a vertical interval of 0-1 meter between the contours for emeralds to generate.
privacynotice:
Privacy notice: all files are processed by your local machine
and aren't uploaded to any server.
error_wrongid: Please enter a valid Minecraft block ID. Only text IDs are supported
error_offset: Please enter correct offset values. Offset values can only be integers
